i_name: John Lutz writing to SITU, July 22, 1972, quoting Charles Owens, Atlanta, GA.

i_account_of_incident: Ron Dooley saw a 15-inch humanlike track while looking for Christmas trees near Collierstown. It sank in 1.5 inches and showed no claw marks. He weighs 215 pounds and sank in one eighth inch.
i_name: Ronald Dooley, 111 McLaughlin St., Lexington, VA 24450, letter Jan. 27, 1986.

i_account_of_incident: Lineman driving on I-81 between Timber Ridge and Staunton, saw something dark walking on two legs in a field. (Timber Ridge not on map)
i_name: Ronald Dooley letterJan. 27, 1986, quoting power company lineman in Rockbridge, Virginia.

i_account_of_incident: Wayne Williamson Jr. found huge tracks in Rupert Williamson's strawberry patch, covering a distance of 200 feet.
i_name: Norfolk, VA, Virginian Pilot, May 5, 1977, and Roanoke, VA, Times, May 3, 1977, quoting Wayne Williamson, 6, and his gandfather Rupert Williamson.

i_account_of_incident: Middle-aged woman told Deputy Mike Taylor that she saw the creature on Rte 734 just off Mountain Hill Rd.
i_name: Danville, VA, Bee, May 17, 1977, quoting Deputy Mike Taylor quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Bobby Hazelwood said he saw a sasquatch-type creature near a pond close to the North Carolina line.
i_name: Danville, VA, Bee, May 17, 1977, quoting Bobby Hazelwood.

i_account_of_incident: Report says Glen Smith was driving on Rte 9 between Heflin and Piedmont when he saw a hulking, 10-foot manlike creature cross the road, taking two lanes in two strides. Neither Rte 9 not Heflin are on road map.
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast, quoting Glen Smith.

i_account_of_incident: Spokesman said seven employees repairing damage after ice storm were moving through a pasture on a rough-terrain vehicle when they saw in the headlights a creature that ran upright like a man, but \there was no way a man could have run that fast.\" They told Robert Huffman that it glided over downed trees without a stumble and turned towards them about 75 yards away at the edge of the woods
i_operator: when it \"appeared to hold a red light close to its chest.\""
i_name: spring
i_distance_to_water: Richmond, VA, Times-Dispatch, Apr. 5, 1978, quoting Virginia Electric and Power Co. spokesman quoting seven unnamed workmen.
i_incident_one_of_a_series: \Glided over downed trees without a stumble\""

i_account_of_incident: Thelma Crisp apparently the only person to report a sighting, but something was heard screaming at night for many months in 100 acres of swampy woods lying between posh subdivisions where George Washington once farmed. Screams were recorded, authorities mounted searches, including helicopter, but nothing found. (Reminiscent of Puyallup, Washington 10 years earlier)
i_name: Washington, DC, Post, May 12, 1979, quoting Thelma Crisp.

i_account_of_incident: Navy commander reported to have seen a sasquatch-like creature in Northwest River Park.
i_name: Ron Dooley letter, Nov. 20, 1986, Chesapeake Post, Aug. 15, 1981, quoting unnamed navy commander.

i_account_of_incident: Ranger Patrick Higgins says that campers and visitors at Northwest River Park near Chesapeake tell of seeing Bigfoot creatures. The only specific account quotes Sherry Davis saying she saw a Bigfoot running through the park campsite. Higgins referes to smell like \an uncovered septic tank.\""
i_name: Warren, OH, Tribune, Jul. 11, 1981, Associated Press story from Chesapeake, VA, quoting Sherry Davis, and Park Ranger Patrick Higgins, quoting various campers. Davis also quoted in National Examiner article, Sept. 1981.

i_account_of_incident: Angela Mize Williams arrived home at night, found dogs cowering on porch and heard a thump beside the car, but saw nothing. Next morning found very large footprints around the house and leading through a field to a wooded area. Prints too big and stride too long for human.
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast, quoting Angela Mize Williams.

i_account_of_incident: Staking out an area by Hwy 1 where he had seen tracks in the past, George Proctor shone a spotlight around at about 2 a.m. and saw a creature standing at the edge of the trees 350 to 400 feet away. It stood still beside a large oak tree for 45 seconds, then turned and walked along the edge of the woods, for 50 to 75 yards, Then turned and walked into the woods, giving a sharp bark as it left.
i_name: George Andrew Proctor Jr.

i_account_of_incident: George Proctor found one complete footprint and three partials, not in succession, about 40 feet from Hwy 1, a half mile south of DeWitt.
i_name: George Andrew Proctor Jr.

i_account_of_incident: George Proctor found four prints, two 18-inch and two 12-inch in red clay on the shoulder of an unidentified road in the northwest corner of Dinwiddie County. The large prints did not show toes and the small ones only the big toe and second toe. He thought the smaller one might have been running, as toe prints were deeper than the heel print.
i_name: George Andrew Proctor Jr.

i_account_of_incident: George Proctor found two footprints, one 15.5 inches one 20.5 inches, in the same area where he had seen 15-inch footprints three months earlier. 1731. These would appear to be the reason for his stakeout at this location that resulted in a sighting at 2 a.m. next day.
i_name: George Andrew Proctor Jr.

i_account_of_incident: Family living off Rte 205 experienced strong odours and nocturnal screaming in 1977, 1978, and the early 1980's, sporadically. On this occasion in 1985 they were sitting in the kitchen when Jeannie, early 20's, saw through the glass door a huge dark figure dashing across the floodlit back yard. Her mother, Mickey Edge, flicked on the carport light and looked out the kitchen window. An 8-foot apelike creature was standing 15 feet away at the edge of the carport. It walked sideways along the house, turned and faced the window. Its eyes glowed white but when it walked towards the carport light the glow went out. Mickey screamed. No account of how the creature departed. Sheriff called but no evidence found.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick report quoting Mickey Edge, Rt. 1, Box 702, King George, VA, and daughter Jeannie (or Gina?).

i_account_of_incident: Mickey Edge and Tracy were picking blueberries in a patch of woods 100 yards behind the Edge home when they saw a 5-foot hairy biped peering out at them through the brush. They fled.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick report quoting Mickey Edge, Rt. 1, Box 702, King George, VA, and 8-year-old neighbour Tracy.

i_account_of_incident: Mickey Edge and friends Tom and Wanda heard a loud moaning sound. Mickey saw a pair of whitish lights moving about in the woods. All the lights were turned out, then Jeannie Edge turned on tlhe carport light, looked out and saw a very heavy 7-foot reddish-brown sasquatch about 40 yards away. It retreated to the woods.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick report quoting Jeannie Edge, Rt. 1, Box 702, King George, VA.

i_account_of_incident: The Edge family found a series of large, humanlike footprints in their back yard. Sheriff's officers measured the stride at over 6 ft.
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast quoting Edge family, Rt. 1, Box 702, King George, VA.

i_account_of_incident: Dave Clark said he had found a 16-inch footprint in skiff of snow, on North Mountain.
i_name: Ron Dooley, 111 McLaughlin St., Lexington, VA., letter Nov. 20, 1986, quoting Dave Clark, 17.

i_account_of_incident: Wayne Johnson, Jay Taylor and Eddie Thompson, driving on Rte 2 near St. Mary's Creek (not on map) saw creature walk across the road ahead, stop and look at them, then enter woods. A quarter hour later they saw it or another in a meadow about half a mile away.
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast, quoting Wayne Johnson, Jay Taylor and Eddie Thompson.

i_account_of_incident: Cutting wood for fire, young man heard a noise and felt someone poking him in the ribs, turned and saw a monster with two huge eyes that shone like balls of fire, far apart. Eight feet tall and shaggy hair all over. It stared at boys then shuffled into darkness. Next morning huge footprints found where it had been, but no one wanted to follow.
i_name: John Keel, Strange Creatures from Time and Space, quoting letter quoting unidentified young men.

i_account_of_incident: A very strange report. Doc Priestly said his car stalled and he found himself stopped close to a monster with its long hair standing straight up. Friends in an accompanying bus came back looking for him, the creature's hair dropped down and his car was working again. Later his car started to sputter and spark and stopped, there was the creature beside the road. The bus came back again, the creature fled into the forest.
i_name: Jerome Clark and Loren Coleman, Flying Saucer Review, Jan.-Feb. 1973, quoting W.C. (Doc) Priestly.

i_account_of_incident: On a lonely backwoods road near Hickory Flats (not on map) between Braxton and Webster counties, Charles Stover rounded a curve and saw a 6 foot creature with hair all over its face and body standing by the road. He almost hit it, stopped and took another look, it was still standing there and he went on. Stover was driving for Dutch Oven Bakeries.
i_name: Charleston, WV, Daily Mail, Dec. 31, 1960, quoting Mrs. Charles Stover quoting her 25-year-old husband.

i_account_of_incident: Cecil Lucas saw three bear-like creatures snipping around an oil pump in his field. When he came out of the house to investigate they ran off, upright, towards the Ohio River, disappearing in the thicket.
i_name: Flying Saucer Review, Jul.-Aug. 1968, quoting Cecil Lucas.

i_account_of_incident: John Lutz wrote that around Blackwater Canyon, near Davis, he learned of the \Canyon Monster\"
i_name: walkes on two legs
i_more_incident_codes_y_n: John Lutz letter to SITU, quoting unnamed sources

i_account_of_incident: Ronald Stark, 18, and Clifford Barnes, 18, turned off I-79 at the Skin Creek exit at 8.15 p.m. and saw an apelike creature standing in the middle of the access road. As they braked to a halt it ran into the brush.
i_name: UFO Report, Dec. 1976, Gray Barker quoting Ronald Stark and Clifford Barnes. Also Weston, WV, Independent, Aug. 25, 1976.

i_account_of_incident: Bill Pruitt heard a sound like babies crying, later spotted under a street lamp what looked like a huge man. As he got out of his car to investigate it \hunkered down\" by the river bank
i_operator: and the next thing he knew it had jumped 30 feet across the Clear Fork River. Pruitt emptied his gun at it and the police chief
i_name: fired 7 shots with a rifle. It just kept going. The two men found no blood
i_distance_to_water: but the thing broke tree limbs 3 inches in diameter
i_effect_of_shot: and left huge \"heart shaped\" footprints in the sand."
i_incident_type: Charleston, WV, Gazette, Aug. 15, 1978, quoting Bill Pruitt, Oceana, WV, policeman, and the police chief.

i_account_of_incident: Jack Heintz reported seeing a huge creature prowling around his home on Schaffenaker Mountain. Item says \the description resembled a Bigfoot
i_name: spring
i_distance_to_water: Bigfoot Co-op, quoting West Virginia Advocate, Apr. 5, 1982, quoting Jack Heintz.

i_name: Hartford, CN, Courant, Aug.. 21, 1895, quoting Rilley W. Smith.

i_account_of_incident: John G. Hall was driving the stage between Winsted, CN, and Sandisfield, MA, when he saw an animal standing by the road at Colebrook. He stopped and drew his pistol. The animal ran across the road on all fours, then leaped over the fence. 6.5 feet tall, white teeth, muscular. He thought it was a gorilla.
i_name: New York, NY, Herald, Aug. 30, 1895, quoting John G. Hall.

i_account_of_incident: Incidents said to have taken place between Winsted, Conn, and Sandisfield, MA. A tall hairy creature was seen stealing chickens and a rabbit, and a man fired at it with a shotgun and birdshot, but did not faze it. Footprints were found in light snow around the coop.
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast, from New York Herald, Aug. 30, 1895.

i_account_of_incident: A 6.5 foot man jumped out of a tree and chased a man. The creature was tracked to a nearby mountain where it was observer entering a hole. Chains were stretched across the entrance but they were broken that night.
i_name: New York, NY, Herald, Aug. 30, 1895.

i_account_of_incident: Keith Auerback said he was investigating reported incidents in a lovers' lane between Trumbull and Monroe, Connecticut. People were seeing a sasquatch-type creature that could run 35 miles an hour and left tracks twice as deep as he could make by jumping off a 3-foot bank. It was big and white, would flee when approached, and was seen only between 10 p.m. and dawn. Letter was to follow, but didn't.
i_name: Keith Suerback, 3960 Hillman Ave., Bronx, NY, 10463, phone call in 1968.

i_account_of_incident: Ben Holten milking cows at 5 a.m., found animals acting strangely, then smelled awful odour. Outside barn ast an 8-foot, dark brown creature standing 20 feet away looking at him. Father called sheriff, and they found 22.5-inch tracks in the cow pasture and leading to the woods. Heels very narrow. Several days later the creature came back, deputies fired pistol shots at it, it turned and ran back in the woods. They followed, found it had walked in a stream, and trail was lost.
i_name: Yeti Newsletter, Sep. 1978, quoting Ben, Dan and Betty Holten, and sheriffs' deputies.

i_account_of_incident: David Buckley and John Fuller went in the barn to check the cows at Valley Farms on Rte 83 and encountered a dark brown hairy creature sitting on a feed bunk watching the cows. It had its hand down in the silage and was either playing in it or eating it. It turned and got up and walked towards the men, arms outstretched. They screamed and it ran slowly around the corner and disappeared. Est. weight 300 pounds, very muscular, dark eyes, good set of teeth.
i_name: Manchester, CN, Journal Inquirer, Aug. 26, 1982, quoting David Buckley and John Fuller.

i_account_of_incident: On an archery range at Bristol Fish and Game Club, noticed an animal in the underbrush, went closer and saw it was an 8.5-foot hairy biped. It ran back into the forest screaming.
i_name: Letter to Don Keating, writer's name omitted.

i_account_of_incident: Informant told Don Keating about footprints found in snow on South Mountain near Bristol by hunters.
i_name: Don Keating phone call, spring, 1990, quoting unnamed source.

i_account_of_incident: Report places incident on Dye Hill Rd. south of Dye Hill on the Hopkinton/Exeter Line. Dye Hill is not on road map and Hopkinton and Exeter are not close or in any way obviously connected. Jim T. and Art D. were returning from hunting, climbed the slope south of Dye Hill, and were resting when Jim noticed the creature standing upright among the rocks on an outcropping about 100 feet north of them. It was watching them and did not move in the second or two before they fled.
i_name: Report by Don Todd of Mutual UFO Network quoting Jim T., 36, and Art D., 37.

i_account_of_incident: Don Wilson and Joe Smith on hunting trip 20 miles from Rockwood on the edge of a big lake, woke at 2 a.m. to see big hairy head looking in cabin window. It stayed five minutes, when it left they got guns and followed until tracks lost on hard snow. Guide told them monster had been known for 50 years and had never hurt anyone. Story suspect in my opinion because hunters took off after creature without wakening professional guide, and because arriving tracks are not mentioned.
i_name: Yeti Newsletter, Sep. 1978, quoting Don Wilson and Joe Smith.

i_account_of_incident: Bob Norton familiar with people of eastern Maine who take for granted the existence of the \Indian Devil\" as described above in their part of the world."
i_name: Sgt. Bob Norton, Pape Air Force Base, N.Car., letter to Argosy, quoting old stories

i_account_of_incident: Cluey heard footsteps approaching as he lay awake. Manlike creature covered with hair walked up to camp, stood there, then walked on into the forest.
i_name: Book \Camping Out\" quoting guide \"Cluey\" according to Eugene Peret
i_type: N.Y. letter to Ivan Sanderson about Pomoola
i_more_incident_codes_y_n: his brother Zeke and an old trapper."

i_account_of_incident: Day after Cluey saw the creature in the night, he and his brother Zeke and the old trapper saw it standing on a rock on an island in the lake. Zeke moved to shoot it and the creature raised its arms. The trapper stopped Zeke, the creature lowered its arms and the men went on their way.
On road by Bigelow Mountain, 1 a.m. on rainy night, passed 7-foot creature standing in the roadway. Enquiring, met a local Frenchman named \Old Pete\" who had seen the creature before
i_distance_to_water: Burn White, Rangeley, Maine, notes of his experiences sent by Richard Perkins, Box 6701, Portland, ME 04101.

i_account_of_incident: Lois, Scott and George Jr. Huntington and Tammy Sairo were cycling half a mile from the Huntington home at Durham, Androscoggin County, across the line in Sagadahoc County, when they encountered the animal. Lois took a spill when she braked her bike in loose gravel. The animal did nothing.
i_name: Portland, ME, Press Herald, Jul. 28, 1973, quoting Lois Huntington, 13, George Huntington Jr., 10, Scott Huntington, 8, and Tammy Sairo, 8, Durham, ME.

i_account_of_incident: Looking for animal children had seen the day before, Neota Huntington coasted car to site, saw the creature standing by the road, but it ran in the woods. She told neighbours, returned and sat in the car while others went in woods, and saw the creature again peering at her through the crotch of a tree 20 feet away. When she called others it disappeare in the woods.
i_name: Portland, ME, Press Herald, Jul. 28, 1973, quoting Mrs. Neota Huntington, Durham, ME.

i_account_of_incident: Debbie and Donna Adams walking on Camp Road from Cobbosseocontee stream where they live. Near Benson Road thay saw a hair-covered manlike creature watching a man chap wood in the woods. It was swaying back and forth. The girls screamed and the creature turned about and wnet across the road and into the woods. It had a white patch on the chest area and a bushy appearance around the jaw line and upper head.
i_name: Ramona Hibner quoting Brent Raynes interview with Debbie Adams, 15, Manchester, ME, and her younger sister Donna.

i_account_of_incident: Mrs. Paul Adams was sitting in the car waiting for her husband, who was tuning a guitar in John Dupont's trailer. She noticed what looked like the figure of a man 6 to 7 feet tall standing by a nearby tree. She watched about 10 minutes as it crouched down with one arm around the tree, apparently listening to the country-western music. She touched the car horn and it got up and started towards her. She leaned on the horn and it stepped back.
i_name: Ramona Hibner quoting Brent Raynes interview with Mrs. Paul Adams, Manchester, ME.

i_account_of_incident: Wilfred Judd, driving on South Solon Road beside the Kennebec River, saw a hairy,, dark brown or black creature, est. 6'5\ tall
i_operator: standing in profile on the road. Hearing the car it turned and dashed to the side. Jamie Robinson
i_name: saw it standing in some alders
i_effect_of_shot: but left when it growled loudly."
i_incident_type: Tim Olson, The Sasquatch Report, July, 1993, quoting Wilfred Judd, 17, and Jamie Robinson, 19.

i_account_of_incident: Mike Frizzell reports stories that 19th Century farmers in Middletown Valley were plagued by appearances of a tall, hairy, apelike creature called the \Monkey Man.\""
i_name: Bigfoot on the East Coast, quoting Mike Frizzell quoting old stories.

i_account_of_incident: Karen Martz saw a strange hairy Bigfoot-type beast.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick, quoting letter to Frederick News, quoting Karen Martz.

i_account_of_incident: M.P. Edwards wrote that when he was a child something in the woods was eating their baby calves whole. One night about midnight he and his brother went into the woods because they heard an awful moaning. The saw great big footprints that looked to be half man and half animal, and they fled.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, quoting M.P. Edwards, Chestertown, MD., entry in Delvarva Historical and Cultural Archives.

i_account_of_incident: Albert Evans, travelling his land with horse and buggy, saw a dark-haired, 7 foot man-beast standing over several of his dead cows.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, quoting Albert Evans; from Delmarva Historical and Cultural Archives.

i_account_of_incident: Man from Chase, who then lived in Churchville, went out at night looking for his cap and saw by lantern a figure seated on a log, like a gorilla, as tall seated as he was standing. Hairy all over. Location was Will Finney Corner, near Rt 155 and Glenville Rd.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Jun. 19, 1975, quoting a Chase, MD, man, telling of events when he was 8.

i_account_of_incident: Frederick papers tell of encounters with the Dway, or Dwayyo, a huge hairy creature, in Gambrell State Park.
i_name: INFO Journal, summer, 1973, quoting Frederick, MD, newspapers.

i_account_of_incident: Bigfoot sighting reported.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, quoting Believe It, Nov. 1978.

i_account_of_incident: Gordon Chaplin article says apelike Dwayyo reported, which screamed and left huge footprints.
i_name: Washington, DC, Post, Potomac Magazine, Oct. 10, 1977.

i_account_of_incident: Gretchen King saw a Bigfoot-like Snallygaster on Westminster Road. A farmer named Fleming reported seeing a similar creature.
i_name: Baltimore, MD, Evening Sun, Nov. 10, 1944, quoting Gretchen King and a farmer named Fleming.

i_account_of_incident: Mrs. William Thurlow heard an unearthly howl and saw a creature at the Baltimore-Carroll county line. It left huge footprints.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Baltimore, MD, Evening Sun, Nov. 16, 1944, quoting Mrs. William Thurlow.

i_account_of_incident: Woman told David Bremer that her son, a pre-teen at the time, had seen the creature in a garbage dump area in a heavily wooded section outside of Hopewell.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, quoting David Bremer quoting unnamed woman quoting her son.

i_account_of_incident: Mrs. Sunderland and her cousin saw a big hairy creature looking in the window of her farmhouse. When she turned on the porch light it fled on two legs.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, undated, and The Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Mrs. Sunderland and her cousin.

i_account_of_incident: Unidentified jogger reported to have seen a sasquatch on a back road.
i_name: The Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting unidentified jogger.

i_account_of_incident: While turning a manure pile behind his mushroom house, H.S. Osborne saw a gorilla-like creature standing at the edge of his cornfield 25 feet away.
i_name: Cecil, MD, Whig, Aug. 27, 1953, quoting H.S. Osborne

i_account_of_incident: Ray Potter and H.S. Osborne saw a 6-foot creature covered with brownish hair with a pink ring around its face, looking at them over a fence on Osborne's farm.
i_name: Cecil, MD, Whig, Aug. 27, 1953, quoting H.S. Osborne and Ray Potter

i_account_of_incident: Farmer Joseph Eggers saw a man-sized brown creature.
i_name: Cecil, MD, Whig, Aug. 27, 1953, quoting Joseph Eggers.

i_account_of_incident: Ike Creek said William Jones was driving his truck on a dirt road off Rte 260 late at night when a large, hairy black animal ran across the road on two legs.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Ike Creek, quoting his uncle, William Jones.

i_account_of_incident: Parked in a wooded area,, Charles and Helene Weaver reported seeing a 7-foot creature with long brown hair covering face and body that approached their car with outstretched hands.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Charles and Helene Weaver. Also York, PA, Dispatch, Feb. 23, 1978.

i_account_of_incident: Pulling into their driveway on Brown Station Road, Reverty Garner and wife saw a large gorilla-like creature standing in their way and hit it with their car. When Garner turned the vehicle around it came directly at him with \red beady eyes.\""
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Washington, DC, Evening Star, Aug. 5 and 8, 1957, quoting Mr. and Mrs. Reverty Garner.

i_account_of_incident: Frances Brady saw the creature looking in the window of her home on Brown Station Road. Her husband, H.L. Brady went looking for it and shot at it as it ran into the woods. Sightings were also reported on Walker Mill Road in Ritchie and Sansbury Road in Forestville, same vicinity as Upper Marlboro.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Washington, DC, Evening Star, Aug. 5, 1957 and Washington, DC, Daily News, Aug. 7, 1987, quoting Frances and H.L. Brady, and others.

i_account_of_incident: A woman walking her two dogs encountered a large, man-like animal with dark hair. The dogs attacked, one was killed, the other fled.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting True UFO's and Outer Space Quarterly, winter, 1960, quoting a lady.

i_account_of_incident: Carl Mdyer saw a hairy, manlike animal run out of his barn and into the woods.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, report on file with Carl Livesay, Patapsco Valley State Park, quoting Carl Meyer.

i_account_of_incident: Policeman on duty saw a Bigfoot-type creature cross a dirt road in front of his car and step over a barbed-wire fence. He yelled at it to halt and it turned and approached him. He fired at it with no effect, then he fled.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting INFO Journal, Mar.-Apr. 1979, quoting policeman.

i_account_of_incident: Susan Daniels saw a huge gorilla-like creature on her family's property near Bethesda Naval Hospital when she was a child.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Susan Daniels.

i_account_of_incident: Patricia Fergesen and husband saw Bigfoot-type creature in Leakin Park. He chased it and it pulled back a tree limb like a slingshot and growled.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting INFO Journal, Mar.-Apr. 1979, quoting Patricia Fergesen and husband.

i_account_of_incident: Dave Thompson jogging at night on country road when a large hairy creature walked out of the woods and into his path.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Dave Thompson.

i_account_of_incident: Woman said she saw a brownish \Dwayo\" chasing cows on a farm. Dwayo is a name usually applied to a large
i_effect_of_shot: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Frederick, MD, News Post, Dec. 8, 1965, quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Hunter reported seeing a black Dwayo.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Frederick, MD, News Post, Dec. 1, 1965, quoting a hunter.

i_account_of_incident: Dave Bush, a big man, told Bob Chance that he surprised a very muscular apeman at an outhouse, and the creature picked him up and dropped him on his head. He fired three pistol rounds at it, not clear whether before or after being dropped.
i_name: Bob Chance quoting Dave Bush, 709 2B, Country Village Apts., Bel Air, MD, 877-9606.

i_account_of_incident: John Lutz reports several Bigfoot sightings from around the Blackwater Wildlife Refuge.
i_name: John Lutz letter to Mark Opsasnick, quoting unnamed informants.

i_account_of_incident: Resident of 12500 Fletchertown Road said that as he drove home one evening a two-legged \Goatman\" ran in front of his car. Also at dusk one day during that summer other residents reported seeing \"Goatman\" walking on a hill behind the house at 12500 Fletchertown Rd."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with residents of Fletchertown Rd., Bowie, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Curt Drury and friends driving down dirt road off Patuxent Road saw something huge blocking the road. High beams showed 10-foot creature, 3 feet wide, covered with green slimy hair. U. of M. Folklore Archives quote Mike Carroll saying there had been at least 25 reports of the creature in the Patuxent Road area.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting University of Maryland Folklore Archives, quoting Curt Drury and friends.

i_account_of_incident: Driving in Druid Hill Park, Charles Edward Patterson and his wife saw a 7.5-foot \Sykesville Monster\" working its way through a patch of woods."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Baltimore, MD, Afro-American, Jun. 19, 1973, quoting Charles Edward Patterson, 20, and wife.

i_account_of_incident: A policeman reported that his car was attacked by some kind of monster that walked on two legs, while he was trapped inside. He filed a report stating that the car was \battered by an unknown entity with a not quite human appearance."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Sykesvill, MD, Herald, Jun. 7, 1973, and current (1993) Sykesville police officials, quoting unidentified policeman.

i_account_of_incident: Woman reported seeing Bigfoot at the Bowie Stud Farm.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Mark Chorvinsky archives, quoting an unidentified woman.

i_account_of_incident: Unidentified woman said that a 7.5-foot Bigfoot walked out onto Rte 197 in front of her car at 1.30 a.m.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Mark Chorvinsky archives, quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Driving down a dirt road beside abandoned railroad tracks in Pocomoke State Forest at a place where Purdue poultry farm dumped its bad eggs, saw glowing eyes, then made out 2 or 3 ape-like creatures, 8 or 9 feet tall and covered with hair, rumaging through egg piles. Horrible stench.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interviews with Jim Webster and Troy Doyle, also involving Art Johnson, all in late teens.

i_account_of_incident: Jim Windsor recalls that Greg Peacock and Boyd Bloodsworth went to the \egg dumping area\" (2006) and saw a huge Bigfoot-type creature covered with dark hair eating eggs from the piles."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interviews with Jim Windsor quoting Greg Peacock and Boyd Bloodsworth.

i_account_of_incident: Judge Dan Long recalls that the day after the initial sighting another group of youths went to the egg-dumping site (2007) and saw several huge brown hairy creatures that left giant human-like footprints all over the dumping area. (White glowing eyes are Judge Long's own recollection, but he has not described the creatures themselves.)
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interviews with Dan Long (now a judge) quoting a group of youths.

i_account_of_incident: Mark Judge knew or knew of several people who saw a two-legged, Bigfoot-type creature sometimes called \Mothman\" or \"Naked Ape\" in Potomac at this time."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Chorvinsky interview with Mark Judge quoting friends and other people.

i_account_of_incident: Frenchy LeRoux saw and tracked a large, hairy, bipedal creature near Klees Mill Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, South Carroll, MD, Herald, Feb. 20, 1980, quoting Frenchy LeRoux.

i_account_of_incident: Two couples approaching an old dilapidated house in Pcomoke State Forest saw a two-legged Bigfot.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Delmarva Historical and Cultural Archives, quoting two couples.

i_account_of_incident: Detective Greg Gittings said there were many Bigfoot sightings in the Little Gunpowder River area where he went hunting.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Detective Greg Gittings, Havre De Grace police department, quoting unnamed witnesses. From Bob Chance files.

i_account_of_incident: Carload of girls claimed to have seen a hairy, manlike, swamp creature along a big ditch, about 5 miles west of Selbyville, Delaware, on the Maryland side of the state line.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick, Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, and Wilmington, DE, Morning News, 1964.

i_account_of_incident: Two accounts from Fletchertown Road: An animal on two legs seen carrying off a dog into the woods, and a creature \half man half goat\" seen by a couple parking. Part of a series of \"Goatman\" reports in Prince George's County in the early '70's."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Prince George's County, MD, News, 0ct. 27, 1971, and University of Maryland Folklore Archives, quoting unnamed sources.

i_account_of_incident: Bigfoot-type creature seen roaming the woods on Lottsford Road Jean Horan reports that several residents of Lottsford Vista Road saw \Goatman\" attacking dogs."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, University of Maryland Folklore Archives, Delmarva Cultural and Historical Archives, quoting unnamed sources.

i_account_of_incident: Several reports of \Goatman\" running in front of cars
i_season: and one of his attacking a couple parked in a car on Tucker Road. Stanford Lizama the only witness named."
i_effect_of_shot: Bigfoot Digest, University of Maryland Folklore Archives, Delmarva Cultural and Historical Archives, quoting a young couple, two girls, Stanford Lizama and girlfriend, friends of Patricia Isidro.

i_account_of_incident: Farmer reported that a half-human, half bear creature killed his dog and left huge, human-like footprints.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Delmarva Historical and Cultural Archives, quoting a farmer.

i_account_of_incident: Several sightings of Bigfoot reported at Ape's Hole Creek.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance's files, quoting unnamed sources.

i_account_of_incident: Janis Terry saw a creature sitting on something in a small wooded area near her house. It stood up, raised its arms and walked back into the woods. Eyes bright \like an owl's.\""
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Chance files, Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Feb. 23, 1978, quoting Mrs. Janis Terry.

i_account_of_incident: Les Illinski wrote that he had talked to several people who had to swerve their car to avoid hitting Goatman standing in the road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Weller, Prince George's Community Collage, Largo, MD, 1986, Les Illinski quoting unnamed individuals.

i_account_of_incident: Les Illinski said that a Lottsford Road resident claimed Goatman peered through her window.
Ray Hayden and Willie Gheen told Mark Opsasnick that they had seen a half-man, half-animal in a field near Riverdale, and also in a wooded area near Zug Road at Bowie, both in Prince George's County.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick interview with Ray Hayden and Willie Gheen

i_account_of_incident: Ray Hayden and Willie Gheen told Mark Opsasnick that they had seen a half-man, half-animal in a field near Riverdale, and also in a wooded area near Zug Road at Bowie, both in Prince George's County.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick interview with Ray Hayden and Willie Gheen

i_account_of_incident: A group of girls reported to have seen Goatman running through their back yard at 8510 Zug Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Prince George's County, MD, News, Nov. 10, 1971, quoting a group of girls.

i_account_of_incident: County Police Captain Lawrence Wheeler reports many calls conscerning Goatman activity in the latter part of 1971. Kathy Edwards and a group of teenagers reported a sighting Nov. 17, a mangy creature sitting on a pickup truck. It ran into the woods.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Washington Post, Nov. 30, 1971, quoting Kathy Edwards and County Police Captain Lawrence Wheeler.

i_account_of_incident: Dave Chenowith reported a Bigfoot sighting.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Dave Chenoweth.

i_account_of_incident: Kathy and Shelley McDonnell and Butchie, Bonnie, Bobbie and Brent Gosnell all saw a 6-foot creature covered with red brown hair jump in front of their vehicle on Mayberry Road, then jump up to the side of the road and run off through a field.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Kathy and Shelley McDonnell, and Butchie, Bonnie, Bobbie and Brent Gosnell.

i_account_of_incident: Investigator Andrew Milhollan told of a camper reporting a Bigfoot at Deep Creek Lake.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Andrew Millhollan interview, quoting unnamed camper.

i_account_of_incident: Mary Ann Habib and a party of friends saw a huge white-haired creature run across Tucker Road on two legs at 1 a.m.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Mary Ann Habib, 15.

i_account_of_incident: Informant's friend was driving on Rte 32 outside Sykesville when he saw a huge beast on two legs with glowing eyes.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, female informant quoting unnamed man.

i_account_of_incident: Anthony Dorsey saw only reflecting eyes, an estimated 7 feet off the ground, but next day he and Sykesville Police Chief Omer Hebert found one good footprint and two partial ones. Dorsey had gone outside at 10.30 p.m. because of the ruckus his dog was making, apparently fighting with something in the woods. He heard crashing sounds as if something was knocking trees over, and there were more crashing sounds after Officer Charles Rupp arrived. Dorsey and Hebert found a broken-off tree as big around as a human fist. Dorsey stressed that the eyes were reflecting, not luminescent as newspapers had reported.
i_name: Monsters of Maryland, Mark Opsasnick, Strange Magazine, 1988, interview with witness, and Sykesville, MD, Herald, May 31, 1973, quoting Anthony Dorsey, 7602 Norris Ave., Sykesville.

i_account_of_incident: Elston Howard, Howdy, Gassaway, 15, late in May saw a patch of fur disappearing in the brush of the ravine behind his home on Schoolhouse Road beside the Patapsco River. Keeping an eye on things, June 3 he thought he saw a large figure in the brush in the back yard and went to investigate. Later he saw a large apelike creature apparently trying to get in the cellar of a neighbour's house some distance away. It darted back in the shadows. Later he saw a large, egg-shaped head stuck up over the dense thicket behind his property, as if the creature was crouched in hiding but looking around periodically. He called his mother, Bessie, and his cousin, Diane Coleman, and all three of them saw the creature stand up and walk through an opening in the back yard before disappearing in heavy brush.
i_name: Strange Magazine, 1988, Monsters of Maryland, Mark Opsasnich quoting Howdy and Bess Gassaway and Diane Coleman. Also Carroll County, MD, Times, Jun. 14, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Three separate sightings close to each other in time and location: Howdy Gassaway saw the creature emerge from the woods at 4.30 p.m. on the railway track between his house and the river. As it stepped onto the path beside the tracks they looked at each other, then it ran west towards a railway tunnel and he went east. He estimated height at at least 8 feet. William C. Rozier saw the creature coming down the track and hid in the bushes until it walked by, less than 20 feet away. He mentioned 7 feet. Tom Williams, checking an electric meter west of the railway tunnel at 5 p.m. thought he had seen a werewolf. He specified fangs and bristled hair. Numerous large but poor footprints were found around the tunnel.
i_name: Strange Magazine, 1988, Monsters of Maryland, Mark Opsasnich quoting Howdy Bess Gassaway, William Rozier and Tom Williams. Also Carroll County, MD, Times, Jun. 14, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Family living on Oklahoma Road reported seeing a large ape in their back yard.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick, quoting Baltimore, MD, News American, June 8, 1973, quoting an unidentified family.

i_account_of_incident: Truck driver on Rte 32 just outside Sykesville saw a large object by the road. As he approached it stood up. Appeared to be a 7 to 8-foot ape, caked with mud from the waist down.
i_name: Strange Magazine, 1988, Mark Opsasnich, Monsters of Maryland, quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro-American, June 11, 1973, quoting an unidentified truck driver.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch reported seen in Druid Hill Park, right in Baltimore city.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Baltimore, MD, News American, Jun. 24, 1973, unnamed source

i_account_of_incident: John Lutz says sasquatch was seen in Anne Arundel County.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro American, Jun. 12, 1973, quoting John Lutz.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch sighting in Woodstock referred to.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro American, Jun. 12, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch sighting in Woodstock referred to.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro American, Jun. 12, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Man claims to have seen a sasquatch in an abandoned church.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting South Carroll, MD, Herald, Jan. 30, 1980, quoting unnamed man.

i_account_of_incident: Fox hunter claims he saw the creature in the field at the intersection of Gaither and Forsythe Roads.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting taped interview between Mike Frizell and Stanley Davis, quoting fox hunter.

i_account_of_incident: Reference to a sighting in Catonsville
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro American, July 14, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Grandmother watched from her porch as two creatures walked through Leakin Park in Baltimore. One was shaggy and grizzly and the other much taller.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Baltimore, MD, Afro American, July 14, 1973, quoting unidentifed grandmother.

i_account_of_incident: Woman called county police saying she saw an 8-foot tall creature in a tree.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Annapolis, MD, Evening Capital, Jul. 21, 1973, quoting unnamed woman

i_account_of_incident: Ann Arundel County police officer reportedly saw an 8-foot, 500 lb. creature run across Sudley Road in front of his car.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting the Evening Capital, Jul. 21, 1973, quoting a county police officer.

i_account_of_incident: Hawthorne Road resident claims he was grabbed by a hairy creature, near his home but fought it off with a flashlight.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, Mark Opsasnick, quoting Baltimore, MD, News American, Aug. 9, 1973, quoting a Hawthorne Road resident.

i_account_of_incident: Military police received a report that a large gorilla-like creature had been seen in the woods near Trimble Road.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, Mark Opsasnick, quoting Baltimore, MD, News American, Aug. 9, 1973, quoting report to military police at Aberdeen Proving Ground. Also Harford, MD, Democrat, Aug. 9, 1973.

i_account_of_incident: Elderly couple said they had seen a huge ape in a swamp near the Bush River.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Tom Sobatka quoting an elderly Edgewood couple.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch seen leaving a dirt cellar.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick, Maryland Update, 1988, quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Jun. 27, 1974.

i_account_of_incident: Pat Hickey and a friend encountered a sasquatch while camping.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Pat Hickey.

i_account_of_incident: H.G. reported that a sasquatch emerged from the woods and ran in front of his car late one night as he was driving down Research Road near Beaver Dam Creek.
i_name: Mark Opsasnick, The Maryland Bigfoot Research Guide, quoting Beltsville Agricultural Research Center security department, quoting a man known as H.G.

i_account_of_incident: The Buttion family reported seeing a sasquatch leave a house-like shelter.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Buttion family.

i_account_of_incident: Mike Pond saw a hair-covered, two-legged \Snallygaster\" walking in the woods on his property off Rte 97."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mike Opsasnick interview with Mike Pond.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch reported seen by an 81-year-old farmer who lives near Deer Creek.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting letter to Society for the Investigation of the Unexplained from Bill Frye, quoting unnamed farmer.

i_account_of_incident: Dodge family, 1000 block Friendship Lane, off Chalk Point Rd., report seeing a sasquatch in their back yard.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Dodge family.

i_account_of_incident: Witness saw a sasquatch cross a road three miles south of Sykesville.
i_name: Mike Jay letter from John lutz, quoting unnamed witness
Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Stan McCarter quoting his grandmother and cousins.

i_account_of_incident: Father Mark Andrzejczuk and three students were fishing in a swampy inlet of the Bird River off Ebenezer Road when they saw a huge apelike creature run upright chasing a deer through an opening in the swamp.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Father Mark Andrzejczuk and three of his students.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch seen carrying a deer.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Jun. 27, 1974.

i_account_of_incident: Stan McCarter and Frank White saw a sasquatch carrying a deer in a wooded area off Ady Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Jun. 27, 1974, and Mark Opsasnick interview with Stan McCarter, quoting McCarter and Frank White.

i_account_of_incident: Two men saw a sasquatch walking up the lane on a nearby farm one evening.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, Mark Opsasnick quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, March 4, 1976, quoting two men.

i_account_of_incident: Peter Hronek told police that he ran into a 7-foot creature standing on two legs while he was driving 50 miles an hour in a light sports car, knocking the creature down. It got up, screamed and ran off into the woods. The car was badly damaged, and there was hair and skin on the bumper. Police had hair analyzed and said it was bovine, but Hronek insists he hit a biped.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, May 1, 1975, quoting Peter Hronek. Also tape by Bob Jones, Society for the Investigation of the Unexplained.

i_account_of_incident: Darlington area woman reported that she found huge human-like footprints in her garden.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, 1975, from Society for the Investigation of the Unexplained file, quoting a Darlington area woman.

i_account_of_incident: Unnamed farmer reported seeing a sasquatch carry a deer through a patch of woods.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Bel Air MD, Aegis, May 20, 1976, quoting unidentified farmer.

i_account_of_incident: Charles Teal reported seeing a Bigfoot-type creature between some trees in a side cover of Deep Creek Lake.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, Mark Opsasnick, quoting a report in Bob Chance file, quoting Charles Teal.

i_account_of_incident: Three teenagers claimed to have seen the creature on three successive nights. They said that they got within 8 feet of it, that it was favoring one leg, and that once when they were following it through the woods it circled and followed them. They took pictures of it and its tracks (not described) but the film somehow got spoiled. Stover indicated there were other witnesses.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, Mark Opsasnick, quoting INFO Journal, March-April, 1979, also Steve Stover article, quoting three boys 16 to 17.

i_account_of_incident: Unnamed woman looked out window and saw sasquatch-type creature standing on her property, illuminated by lights from the cars of departing guests. Bob Chance was called. His search turned up nothing but a faint foul odour. Later the creature showed up again and the woman's husband and brother went out and got about 15 feet from it. I stood near the garden, swaying, and they went back to the house. The woman's grandmother then saw it out the window and screamed. When they looked again it was gone. Police were called but would not come.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Mar. 4, 1976, quoting an unidentified woman, her huband, her brother and her grandmother.

i_account_of_incident: Two cousins walking up the lane of a farm after dark, a tall, dark creature jumped out of the bushes and ran away on two legs. One cousin was involved in another sighting at Ady two years later.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Mar. 4, 1976, quoting two unnamed men.

i_account_of_incident: Two brother-in-law found tracks in their cornfield.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Mar. 4, 1976, quoting two men; the brothers-in-law involved in 2067.

i_account_of_incident: Becky Simms reported seeing a sasquatch-like creature outside her trailer on Sharon Acres Road on three different occasions. Bob Chance later found 3-toed prints 17\ by 6.5\" there."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Becky Simms

i_account_of_incident: Woman saw a 7 foot creature run through her back yard. Sgt. George Brooks responded and found the woman's Alsatian torn apart, found 18\ tracks and heard the creature scream in the woods that stretch down to the Bird River."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Sgt. George Brooks, Baltimore County police, interviewed by Mark Opsasnick, quoting an unnamed woman. Also Fate magazine, Dec. 1990.

i_account_of_incident: Amtrak engineers tell of seeing a huge ape cross the railroad tracks in Harewood Park, a Chase subdivision.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Tom Sobotka quoting Amtrack railroad engineers.

i_account_of_incident: Couple claimed to have cornered a sasquatch in a pumping station on the railroad tracks near Harewood Road. Ricky Roberts and James Holthaus investigated.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interviews with Patrolmen Ricky Roberts and James Holthaus, quoting unnamed couple.      (Two separate reports)

i_account_of_incident: Couple claimed to have seen a sasquatch in the construction area of a new house off Harewood Road. James Holthaus and Jeff Shanks investigated.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interviews with Patrolmen Jeff Shanks and James Holthaus, quoting unnamed couple.

i_account_of_incident: While bike riding, elderly man saw a sasquatch in the woods at the intersection of Ebenezer and Earls Roads. Patrolman Gene Rayburn found a mashed-down path in the brush.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Patrolman James Holthaus, quoting Patrolman Gene Rayburn and unnamed elderly man.

i_account_of_incident: Daughter of Mrs. Tom Sobotka reported seeing a creature with long brown hair that kind of flopped run by her and up a road into the woods by her home.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Washington DC, Post, Oct. 10, 1976, quoting Mrs. Tom Sobotka's daughter.
Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Ronny Williams.

i_account_of_incident: Playing hide and seek, Ed Horton went to hide in an old corn crib in a field. Heard heavy breathing behind him, saw huge manlike creature covered with hair and smelling like a hog pen standing behind him. He fled.
i_name: BFRO from Ed Horton CIA about incident when he was 11 or 12

i_account_of_incident: Area residents claim to have seen Bigfoot emerge from the woods near the Rubberset Co. on Rte 413 outside the town limits, big bulky, covered with hair and with big feet.
i_name: Easton, MD, Star-Democrat, Oct. 14, 1976, quoting area residents.

i_account_of_incident: Richard Tincher and Alston Blankenship reported seeing a 10 foot creature with white glowing eyes near the state line south of Fawn Grove, Pennsylvania.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, from Bob Chance files quoting Richard Tincher and Alston Blankenship.

i_account_of_incident: Driving to work at Goddard Space Flight Center in the early morning fog, a NASA engineer saw a huge brown or black hairy creature lumbering along with a dog snapping at its legs. After a short while it reached down with one arm, scooped up the dog and threw it off the Powder Mill overpass down onto I-95. As his car got closer it ran off into the wooded area east of I-95 at a high rate of speed.
i_name: Believe It, Nov. 1978, quoting a N.A.S.A. engineer.

i_account_of_incident: Couple parked in a sports car on a back road off Rte 40 near Patapsco Valley State Park heard noises and say red eyes in rear view mirror. Turned to see huge ape-like creature standing on the edge of the woods directly behind them. They drove off and it ran through the woods beside them, keeping up for several yards.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Steve Stover quoting unnamed couple.

i_account_of_incident: Ken Wolinsky reported seeing a sasquatch off Rte 165.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Chance file, quoting Ken Wolinsky.

i_account_of_incident: Debbie Carpenter and Kevin Epley were walking on a wooded pathway when they saw what looked like a man sitting on a log. She approached, and a hunch-backed creature 7 feet tall with black hair covering its face started walking towards them. She said it \walked funny
i_operator: like it was dragging its feet. They fled."
i_name: fall
i_distance_to_water: Annapolis, MD, Evening Capitol, Oct. 19. 1977, quoting Debbie Carpenter, 13, of 1401 Pennington Court, and Kevin Epley, 5, of 1056 Pine Crest Drive.

i_account_of_incident: David Strong reported seeing a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Apr. 18, 1979, quoting David Strong.

i_account_of_incident: Ray Norman told of seeing sasquatch several times walking on his farm of Rte 543.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Kathy Smith quoting the late Ray Norman.

i_account_of_incident: Phil Adams reported that a huge animal with long hair \down on all fours\" attacked his farm animals. Neighbours reported seeing dogs chasing a large hairy creature."
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Phil Adams and neighbours.

i_account_of_incident: A sasquatch sighted exiting an abandoned blast shelt near an old quarry at Rock Run in the area of the Susquehanna River.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Feb. 9, 1978, quoting Bob Chance quoting anonymous source.

i_account_of_incident: Unidentified witness said a sasquatch stepped onto a back road and approached him.
i_name: The Maryland Bigfoot Reference Guide, from Bob Chance files, quoting unnamed source.

i_account_of_incident: Bob Lazarra, plotting reports from southern Pennsylvania and northern Maryland, went looking for tracks in Rocks State Park, along a creek he thought the creature was following. He found nearly a mile and a half of tracks sinking 7 to 8 inches deep in frozen snow where a man sank 2 inches. The tracks had a five-foot stride over rough terrain. Police, park rangers, zoo personnel or the Smithsonian would not come and look. He took numerous good pictures.
i_name: John Ketwig, 1359 Monaco Dr., Severn MD, letter to John Green regarding tracks found by Bob Lazarra, Baltimore.

i_account_of_incident: Janice and Renee Terry watched a large gorilla-like creature standing at the back of their property for about 5 minutes. When their dogs approached the creature a smaller, similar beast walked over to the larger one, took its hand, and they both walked into the woods. No indication of relative size.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Janis and Renee Terry.

i_account_of_incident: Carol Keyser reported seeing a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Carol Keyser.

i_account_of_incident: A farmer on Davis Road reported seeing a bipedal creature walking across his field followed by two smaller creatures down on all fours.
i_name: Steve Stover quoting Carl Livesay, Patapsco Valley State Park official, quoting a farmer. farmer.

i_account_of_incident: Two sightings. Victor Galluzzo saw a 7 to 8-foot hair-covered creature looking the picture window of his home on Fallston Road. Later it was there again and Dan Galluzzo, Victor's father, also saw it. When they arose from their chairs it ran or walked (two accounts differ) away. It had long chipped teeth and its hair was matted with leaves.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Galluzzos. Also York, PA, Dispatch, May 23, 1978, Bob Chance quoting but not naming Galluzzos.

i_account_of_incident: Unnamed witness told Jim Dutton that he saw a sasquatch-type creature swim across the Potomac River and walk off into woods on his property.
i_name: Bigfoot Co-op, June, 1990, Mark Opsasnick quotting Jim Dutton quoting unnamed witness.

i_account_of_incident: Deer hunter reported seeing a giant hairy apelike creature walk across Rte 301.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest and Bigfoot Co-op, June, 1990, Mark Opsasnick quoting interview with Ronny Williams quoting unnamed deer hunter.

i_account_of_incident: Mike Gifft claims rangers from both the state and the national park have seen a large hairy biped.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Mike Gifft quoting Cunningham Falls State Park rangers and Catoctin National Park rangers.

i_account_of_incident: Telephone line workmen reported seeing a sasquatch in the woods just off the Baltimore-Washington Parkway, just north of the Rte 197 intersection.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Ronny Williams quoting telephone line workmen.

i_account_of_incident: Fisherman reported face-to-face encounter with large, hairy, apelike creature at the Union Dam near Rte 40.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Steve Stover quoting a fisherman.

i_account_of_incident: Man said he encountered a sasquatch off Rte 50.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting unnamed man's letter to Mark Chorvinsky.

i_account_of_incident: Students saw a sasquatch near the Rocky Gorge Reservoir.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Chris Cantwell quoting unnamed students from Pallotti High School.

i_account_of_incident: Kelley boy and friend were in back pasture of Carr farm where there is a trash dump in a gulley, a quarter mile from the Rocky Gorge Reservoir on the Patuxent River. He saw what he thought was a tree stump, then realized it was walking. The boys fled. No height mentioned, but previous telephone conversation presumably established that this was a sasquatch-size creature.
i_name: Letter to Bob Chance from Martha Kelley, 15927 Batson Rd., Spencerville, MD, 20868 quoting her son Dennis and a friend.

i_account_of_incident: Reference to a sasquatch sighting, with no specifics.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting Believe It, Nov. 1978, quoting unnamed source.

i_account_of_incident: Truck drivers reported seeing an ape-like creature at a landfill.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Believe It, Nov. 1978, quoting truck drivers.

i_account_of_incident: Sasquatch reported seen scrounging through garbage at the landfill on the bank of the Patuxent River off Rte 198 at 6.30 a.m. It was said to be a female.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from UFO Ohio Newsletter No. 27, quoting anonymous source.

i_account_of_incident: Woman came out on her porch and saw a large, dark biped examining her lamp post.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest quoting South Carroll, MD, Herald, Feb. 20, 1980 quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Boys found footprints on the bank of a small creek. One was clear, the others smeared.
i_name: Martha Kelley letter to Bob Chase.

i_account_of_incident: Hunter reported to have seen a hair-covered, apelike creature near the Holtwood Dam.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Mar. 1, 1979, quoting a hunter.

i_account_of_incident: Howdy Gassaway said construction workers at a housing project had seen the \Sykesville monster.\""
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Howdy Gassaway, quoting construction workers.

i_account_of_incident: David Strong and Vallie Channell found two tracks north of Rte 155 near the old B & O railroad tracks. They were about 50 yards apart, on a steep hill a half mile from the Susquehanna River.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Apr. 18, 1979, quoting David Strong and Vallie Channell, Havre de Grace, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Mike Blevins reports a sasquatch sighting.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Mike Blevins

i_account_of_incident: Investigating strange behavior of his dogs, Dave Ramsey went out and saw a large figure standing between trees uphill from him. It shielded its eyes from his flashlight, then turned and walked away, breaking branches as it went.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Feb. 5, 1981, Bob Chance quoting Dave Ramsey.

i_account_of_incident: A few days after her husband' sighting, Mrs. Dave Ramsey saw a dark form standing in a field next to their driveway as she left for work.
i_name: Bel Air, MD, Aegis, Feb. 5, 1981, Bob Chance quoting Mrs. Dave Ramsey.

i_account_of_incident: Desaray Donavon's aunt and uncle were driving on Rte 4 at 9 p.m. when a large, dark biped walked in front of their car. They hit it, slightly damaging their car, and it ran off into the woods. Donavan also reports having seen the shining green eye of an 8-foot creature looking in his living room window in March, 1980, and red eyes of a 9-foot creature looking into his bedroom window in August, 1980.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, letter from Desaray Donavon, quoting an aunt and uncle.

i_account_of_incident: Park ranger reported a sasquatch sighting.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting park ranger.

i_account_of_incident: A sasquatch sighting reported on Kern's hog farm.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting unnamed source.

i_account_of_incident: Driving to work at 2.30 a.m., Michael Green saw a 7 to 8-foot creature swaying back and forth at the garbage dumpster behind the Woodshed Restaurant. He watched for 10 minutes as it sorted through the dumpster, which contained very smelly catfish among other things. It then walked slowly away.
i_name: Bob Chance report quoting Michael Green.

i_account_of_incident: Family reported a sasquatch sighting on their property.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with anonymous family.

i_account_of_incident: Bill Ogle says Huntington area farmers have reported seeing a huge ape-like creature.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Bill Ogle quoting farmers.

i_account_of_incident: Firetower lookout reported seeing a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Sykesville policewoman Pam Skidmore, quoting a fire tower lookout.

i_account_of_incident: Charles Gescher Jr. reported seeing a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Charles Getscher Jr.

i_account_of_incident: County police investigated a sasquatch sighting near the Christian Brothers Seminary on Ammendale Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnich quoting Sharon Weidenfeld quoting Prince George's County police.

i_account_of_incident: Robert Chaney saw a creature he identified as Bigfoot in heavy brush by the Patuxent River.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Robert Chaney.

i_account_of_incident: Rick Hutton and friends saw a sasquatch-type creature on the banks of the Susquehanna River. It followed them as they ran off. Hutton is supposed to have take a picture of it.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Ricky Lee Anderson, quoting Rick Hutton and friends.

i_account_of_incident: Don Ramsey sys he has seen a sasquatch on at least six separate occasions on his property at 6.30 a.m.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Dave Ramsey.

i_account_of_incident: County police said an anonymous caller reported sighting a sasquatch in a corn field on Edmonston Road near Beaver Dam Creek.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Osasnick quoting Sharon Weidenfeld quoting county police quoting anonymous caller.

i_account_of_incident: Charles Teal reported a sasquatch sighting where the Little Gunpowder River flows under I-95.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance files, quoting Charles Teal

i_account_of_incident: County police told Matt Neufeld there had been sasquatch sightings reported at Poolesville.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Washington Times reporter Matt Neufeld quoting police sources.

i_account_of_incident: County police told Matt Neufeld there had been sasquatch sightings reported at Frederick.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting Washington Times reporter Matt Neufeld quoting police sources.

i_account_of_incident: Patrolman Brent Hayes was driving down Rte 6 near Nanjemoy Creek at 3.30 a.m. when he saw a \huge thing\" 6 to 7 feet tall and covered with tan hair partially walk out of the woods then turn and go back. He stopped
i_operator: rolled down the window and smelled a horrible musty odour
i_season: and heard the creature run off. Next day he found a trail but no prints. For six weeks there had been complaints from residents about nocturnal screaming. Other patrolmen were reported to have seen the creature
i_name: but none would be interviewed."
i_type: Bigfoot Co-op, June, 1990, Mark Opsasnick quoting State Police patrolman Brent Hayes.

i_account_of_incident: Mickey Bell and siblings said to have seen a sasquatch while rabbit hunting.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting the Edge family of Colonial Beach, VA, quoting Micky Bell.

i_account_of_incident: Don Kreze saw a large two-legged creature run through a corner of a field off Stumpf's Road near Bird River.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Don Kreze.

i_account_of_incident: WSSC (?) Watershed Patrol Rangers received sasquatch sighting reports from residents along the Patuxent River, according to Fred Grimmnetz.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Fred Grimmnitz quoting WSSC Watershed Patrol Rangers quoting residents.

i_account_of_incident: Jerry Kirkwood told Lynda Walter that he had seen a sasquatch-type creature on his property on Allibone Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Lynda Walter quoting Jerry Kirkwood

i_account_of_incident: Gunpowder Falls State Park manager Rick Barton said that Ranger Chris Barton said his father had seen a bear-like creature walking into a wooded area on two legs.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Chris Bushman quoting his father.

i_account_of_incident: Woman reported to Gunpowder Falls State Park Manager Rick Barton that she had seen a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Rick Barton, manager of Gunpowder Falls State Park, quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Woman allegedly saw a silver and black Bigfoot creature at Liberty Reservoir.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Dennis Volkman file, quoting 40-year-old lady.

i_account_of_incident: Fisherman reporte to have seen a black ape-like creature at Liberty Reservoir.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Dennis Volkman files, quoting fisherman

i_account_of_incident: Couple reported seeing an 8-foot creature on Queenstown Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Dennis Volkman files quoting unnamed couple

i_account_of_incident: A co-worker of Dennis Volkman reported seeing a Bigfoot-type creature running across Rte 301.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Dennis Volkman files quoting a co-worker of Volkman's.

i_account_of_incident: Resident of Graeloch Road reported seeing a 9-foot sasquatch run through his back yard towards the Rocky Gorge Reservoir. 18-inch footprints reported found.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Dennis Volkman files quoting unnamed man.

i_account_of_incident: Woman reorted seeing Bigfoot on her back porch, according to Steve Stover.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick quoting Steve Stover quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Woman reported seeing a sasquatch.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Strange Magazine file, quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: At 10 p,.m., unnamed woman saw a huge manlike animal moving through her backyard.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Strange Magazine file, quoting unnamed woman.

i_account_of_incident: Checking out a wooded area east of Rte 1 and north of Muirkirk Road where packs of coyotes had been reported, a few days after a heavy snowfall, Mark Opsasnick found tracks coming out of the woods and circling the abandoned Howard University Physics-Astronomy physical plant and observatory, then going 200 yards through a clearing and ending at a gravel road. They showed heel impressions and an arch, but toes were smeered. He felt that the long stride, up to 78 inches, ruled out melted out smaller tracks. Pictures turned out well.
i_name: Bigfoot Co-op, April, 1988, Mark Opsasnick report of track find.

i_account_of_incident: Allen Galbraith reported a sighting to Bob Chance.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Chance file, quoting Allen Gailbraith.

i_account_of_incident: Catherine Coleman saw a sasquatch running towards the woods on her property.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Catherine Coleman, Kalmia, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Catherine Coleman saw a sasquatch for a second time, a tall creature covered with white hair, as she was walking near her mother's trailer on Kalmia Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Catherine Coleman, Kalmia, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Willie Coleman and his brother in law, Sam Pounds, checked some woods on his property where extremely loud groaning could be heard. By flashlight they found an 8-foot, furry, white creature that \took off like a jet\" on two legs. Coleman shot at it with a shotgun
i_operator: without effect. There was a terrible musty odour. Willie Coleman told Mark Opsasnick that several neighbours had also seen the creature."
i_name: summer
i_distance_to_water: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Willie Coleman, Kalmia, MD, and Sam Pounds.

i_account_of_incident: James Rumsey, walking home at night, had a sasquatch come up behind him. He turned and saw it, and fled.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with James Rumsey, Kalmia, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Barbara Rumsey told Mark Opsasnick that a group of woman walking on Kalmia Road had seen a sasquatch in the daytime, and that neighbours on Kalmia Road had had sightings. She had previously reported to Bob Chance that she had seen the shadow of a huge creature running across her property and into the woods, and that there had been animal mutilations and screams in the night.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Barbara Rumsey, Kalmia, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Mary Pounds said that the Kalmia sasquatch was seen by a family living on flats near the Rte 1 bridge on Forge Hill Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Mary Pounds, quoting unnamed Kalmia, MD, family.

i_account_of_incident: Mary Pounds said Darryl Harris, sitting in a parked car off Kalmia Road, on saw a sasquatch standing in the woods.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Mary Pounds, quoting Darryl Harris.

i_account_of_incident: At 11 p.m., at Clayton and Shirley Avenue, David and Elaine Banning saw a huge hairy creature with long arms walk into a wooded area. The smell was so foul it made his eyes water.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with David and Elaine Banning.

i_account_of_incident: Kalmia Road family told Bob Chance they had seen the creature on three different occasions.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Chance files quoting Kalmia Road family.

i_account_of_incident: Man living on Kalmia Road reported to Bob Chance that he had seen a sasquatch in the daytime.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Bob Chance files quoting man living on Kalmia Road.

i_account_of_incident: Campers said that as they were driving along Stafford Road on top of Town Hill Mountain a hair-covered \man\" jumped across the hood of their car and on top of their camper
i_operator: then ran off into the woods."
i_name: summer
i_distance_to_water: Bigfoot Digest, from Enigma Project files, quoting some campers.

i_account_of_incident: Unidentified woman reported to the Department of Natural Resources that she had seen a sasquatch cross Rte 381.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, quoting officer in Department of Natural Resources, Cheltenham office, quoting unidentified woman.

i_account_of_incident: Kathy Anderson, on her way to work shortly after dawn, watched a huge, hairy, apelike creature walk across Rte 136 in front of her car and enter the woods at the base of the Deer Creek bridge.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, from Bob Chance file, quoting Kathy Anderson

i_account_of_incident: Eric Heiderman and Thomas Kondash saw a 3 to 4-foot, black brown, hairy creature run on two legs through a wooded area behind the Heidermans' back yard
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnich intv. with Heiderman family, quoting Eric Heiderman, 11, and Thomas Kondash, 13, Odenton, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Hiking in Susquehanna State Park, Brian Billings and a friend saw a sasquatch-type creature slide down a hill in a wooded area.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Ricky Lee Anderson quoting Brian Billings and a friend.

i_account_of_incident: Driving home on Rte 381 at 10 p.m., Claudia Greene saw a hair-covered, heavy-set, 6-foot creature run across the road 10 feet in front of her car.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Claudia Greene, 31.

i_account_of_incident: In the kitchen of her cousin's home on Aquasco Road at 6.30 p.m., Marie Serrano looked out the front window and saw a creature stooped down in a patch of trees about 50 feet away. It got up, appearing to be about 6 feet high and 350 pounds, and walked into the woods on two legs. Family had been hearing unidentified screams at night for the past year.
i_name: Bigfoot Co-0p, June, 1990, and Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick interview with Marie Serrano, 33.

i_account_of_incident: Bernard Getscher said that while in his barn on Taylor Road at night he watched a hair-covered creature walk in and out of the treeline towards the barn, then try to force its way into the building.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnich intv. with Bernard Getscher.

i_account_of_incident: Hearing screams early one morning in woods behind their house on Countryside Court, Sanja Maske and Anita Rodriguez saw a smallish creature covered with brown hair walking through their back yard on two legs. It left tracks in the snow, which were not described.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Sonja Maske and Anita Rodruguez, Silver Spring, MD.

i_account_of_incident: At the intersection of Ady and Taylor Roads, after midnight, Dave Ramsey Jr. saw a giant apelike creature standing by the stop sign. It was taller than the sign. The creature chased his vehicle as he droe off. He told Dave Ramsey Sr. and both returned to the site, where they saw the creature walking near the edge of a field.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Dave Ramsey Sr. also quoting Dave Ramsey Jr.
Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Walter, Lynda, Jennifer and Douglas Walter.

i_account_of_incident: Peggy Nichols heard an unusual scream in the back yard of her home on Dickerson Road at 1 a.m. and woke her sister Carol. They opened the back porch door and saw a 7-foot, hairy creature moving through a corner of the yard 30 feet away. Screams had been heard for several weeks, blamed on wildcats, for which nearby Wildcat Creek was named. (But was it really wildcats screaming in the first place?)
i_name: The Sasquatch Report, Jul. 1990, and Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Peggy Nichols, 32, and her sister Carol, 25, Dickerson, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Petey Smith was in his back yard on Dickerson Raod at 1 p.m. when he heard branches snapping in the underbrush close by, then saw a 6-foot bipedal creature covered with red brown hair walk through a partial clearing in the woods 40 feet away. It turned and looked athim, then walked deeper into the woods. It had reddish skin around the eyes and nose area. (May be the same house as 2180)
i_name: The Sasquatch Report, Aug. 1990, also Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Petey Smith, 40, Dickerson, Md.

i_account_of_incident: Ruby Williams said she saw a strange, hair-covered creature in her back yard on Allibone Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Kirkwood family, quoting Ruby Williams, Bel Air, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Mary said she saw a sasquatch creature pick up two of her pigs and walk off into the woods. She lives on Winters Run Road, town not mentioned.
i_name: Sasquatch Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Ricky Lee Anderson, quoting Mary. (stet)

i_account_of_incident: Lynda Walters said that a group of women saw the creature while they were walking along Kalmia Road.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Lynda Walter, quoting a group of women at Kalmia, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Driving on Forge Hill Road at Deer Creek Bridge at 10 p.m., Helen Walter saw a huge hairy, dark-haired biped with long arms run across the road and leap over the bridge rail towards the banks of Deer Creek.
i_name: Bigfoot Digest, Mark Opsasnick intv. with Helen Walker.

i_account_of_incident: Caller told police he had been accosted in the woods by a \7-8 foot tall hairy thing.\""
i_name: The Track Record, Sept., 1993, quoting Kurt, quoting friend who monitored police radio, quoting anonymous caller.

i_account_of_incident: Becky Montgomery said she was driving home on McCauley Road, at Clark Lane, when a 7-foot, 600-pound, dark brown creature with male genetalia swinging landed in the middle of the road close in front of her car as she was lighting a cigarette. It did not look at her, and was across the road in two strides.
i_name: From Bob Chance files, quoting Becky Montgomery, 24, 410-658-4253.

i_account_of_incident: Driving through Phragmites Swamp, George and Arlene Griffin saw a deer bolt across the road, then, as their car \idled along\" they saw in the rear-view mirror a tall
i_season: manlike creature come out on the road about 100 feet behind them. They watched it for about 2 minutes
i_name: and it watched them. Fur was lighter on face."
i_type: Bob Chance file, quoting George Griffin, 116 Hunter Court, Havre de Grace, MD, 21078, 939-7157, and wife Arlene

i_account_of_incident: Gary Kovach, a biology instructor at Notre Dame college, found big footprints in snow at his home, strides 68 to 78 inches, cleared 5-foot fence in stride. This and the next three track sets all made the same night and within a few miles of each other. Jamie Costello, Channel 2, photographed thesse. George Stover also mentioned.
i_name: Bob Chance file, quoting Gary Kovach, 2414 Derby Dr. Fallston, MD.

i_account_of_incident: The morning after a snowfall, Bob and Jimi Toal found huge tracks passing 20 feet from their house, on a wooded one-acre lot near Gunpowder State Park. They started on a vacant lot went through an open area, and were lost in brush after about 300 yards. Bob Chance was called. He thought the prints had been enlarged by drifting snow and were probably about 17 inches by 7 inches originally.
i_name: Bob Chance file, quoting Bob and Jimi Toal, 800 Kary Lou Circle, Pleasant Hills, MD, 879-9838.

i_account_of_incident: Bertha Cox found tracks in the morning at her home on the Old Joppa Road from Fallston to Bel Air. Appeared to have been made just after snow stopped. Melvin Quick videod them.
i_name: Bob Chance files, quoting Bertha Cox, 1015 Old Joppa Rd., Fallsont, MD.
i_superhuman_action: Stepped over fence, indicate 7 to 8 foot height.

i_account_of_incident: Tom Spicer found tracks at his home across the Little Gunpowder River valley from the Toal place and about three quarters of a mile farther south. No measurements noted but size said the be similar. The tracks went around a goldfish pond and the large goldfish were gone. Walking between the two track finds, Bob Chance found a mutilated deer in the valley. The Baltimore-Harford county line runs down the center of the valley.
i_name: Bob Chance files, quoting Tom Spicer, Glenbauer Rd, Jerusalem, MD.

i_account_of_incident: Robeert Montgomery found tracks coming up to his house and walking around cars.
i_name: Bob Chance files, quoting Robert Montgomery, 72 Monty Lane, Conowingo, MD, 410-378-3681.

i_account_of_incident: Students at Bredgewater State Teachers' College reported to police that something walking upright was making a lot of racket in the vicinity of the college. Police found nothing.
i_name: Letter from Andrew Galligan, 220 Stony Brook Rd, Raynham, MA, in file of Society for the Investigation of the Unexplained, quoting Sgt. Wiliam Nichols, Bridgewater, MA, police, quoting students.

i_account_of_incident: Policeman responding to a complaint by a Bridgewater resident that a \thing\" was making a noise in his back yard was sitting parked in the dark when something started to pick up the rear of his car. He spun the car around and got his spotlight on something like a bear running around the corner of the house. Nothing said about posture
